verses.verse: O Israel,<WH3478> return<WH7725> to the LORD<WH3068> your God;<WH430> for you have fallen<WH3782> by your iniquity.<WH5771>

Take<WH3947> with you words,<WH1697> and turn<WH7725> to the LORD:<WH3068> say<WH559> to him, Take<WH5375> away all<WH3605> iniquity,<WH5771> and receive<WH3947> us graciously:<WH2896> so will we render<WH7999> the calves<WH6499> of our lips.<WH8193>

Asshur<WH804> shall not save<WH3467> us; we will not ride<WH7392> on horses:<WH5483> neither<WH3808> will we say<WH559> any more<WH5750> to the work<WH4639> of our hands,<WH3027> You are our gods:<WH430> for in you the fatherless<WH3490> finds mercy.<WH7355>
I will heal<WH7495> their backsliding,<WH4878> I will love<WH157> them freely:<WH5071> for my anger<WH639> is turned<WH7725> away from him.
I will be as the dew<WH2919> to Israel:<WH3478> he shall grow<WH6524> as the lily,<WH7799> and cast<WH5221> forth<WH5221> his roots<WH8328> as Lebanon.<WH3844>
His branches<WH3127> shall spread,<WH3212> and his beauty<WH1935> shall be as the olive<WH2132> tree, and his smell<WH7381> as Lebanon.<WH3844>

They that dwell<WH3427> under his shadow<WH6738> shall return;<WH7725> they shall revive<WH2421> as the corn,<WH1715> and grow<WH6524> as the vine:<WH1612> the scent<WH2143> thereof shall be as the wine<WH8492> of Lebanon.<WH3844>

Ephraim<WH669> shall say, What<WH4100> have I to do any more<WH5750> with idols?<WH6091> I have heard<WH6030> him, and observed<WH7789> him: I am like a green<WH7488> fir<WH1265> tree. From me is your fruit<WH6529> found.<WH4672>

Who<WH4310> is wise,<WH2450> and he shall understand<WH995> these<WH428> things? prudent,<WH995> and he shall know<WH3045> them? for the ways<WH1870> of the LORD<WH3068> are right,<WH3477> and the just<WH6662> shall walk<WH3212> in them: but the transgressors<WH6586> shall fall<WH3782> therein.
